intro: Siphocampylus tupaeformis var. dulcis, commonly known as the sweet siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible, aromatic leaves that are often used in traditional Andean cuisine. Its botanical features include finely divided leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The variety 'dulcis' is distinguished by its sweeter flavor compared to other varieties of the species.
